places_to_visit.name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
places_to_visit.description: The Kashi Vishwanath Temple is one of the most sacred Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is a major pilgrimage site and is located on the banks of the Ganges River.

places_to_visit.name: Sarnath
places_to_visit.description: Sarnath is an important Buddhist site where Lord Buddha gave his first sermon. It features ancient ruins, stupas, and the Sarnath Archaeological Museum.

places_to_visit.name: Dashashwamedh Ghat
places_to_visit.description: Dashashwamedh Ghat is one of the most famous ghats in Varanasi. It is known for its evening Aarti ceremony, which is a spectacular ritual of worship with fire lamps.

places_to_visit.name: Manikarnika Ghat
places_to_visit.description: Manikarnika Ghat is one of the oldest and most sacred ghats, primarily associated with Hindu cremation rituals. Itâ€™s a significant site for understanding local customs and traditions.

places_to_visit.name: Ramnagar Fort
places_to_visit.description: Ramnagar Fort is a historic fort located on the banks of the Ganges River. It offers insight into the local royal history and architecture.

activities: Explore the ancient ruins and museum at Sarnath
Witness the Aarti ceremony at Dashashwamedh Ghat
Learn about local customs at Manikarnika Ghat
tips_and_tricks: Wear comfortable and respectful clothing for temple visits.
Carry bottled water and snacks during sightseeing.
Be prepared for crowds, especially at ghats and temples.
